title: Lesson B1-4 Assessment: Class I Mastery

questions.question: What characterizes Class I verbs in Georgian?

options.text: They are transitive verbs that take direct objects

questions.explanation: Class I verbs are transitive verbs that take direct objects - someone does something TO something or someone.

questions.question: What is the complete Series I verb structure?
questions.explanation: The complete Series I structure is: Subject Marker + Preverb + Version + Root + Suffix

questions.question: ვდაიწერ [vdaints'er] has which components?

options.text: ვ- 'I' + და- preverb + ი- subjective version + წერ 'write'

questions.explanation: ვდაიწერ [vdaints'er] contains: ვ- subject marker + და- preverb + ი- subjective version + წერ root.

questions.question: What does ვდაუწერ [vdauts'er] mean?

options.text: I am writing for someone (perfective + objective)

questions.explanation: ვდაუწერ [vdauts'er] contains: ვ- 'I' + და- preverb (perfective) + უ- objective version + წერ 'write' = 'I will write for someone.'

questions.question: Match conjugations to meanings:
questions.explanation: Base forms show person, preverbs add aspect/direction, versions add perspective.

questions.question: Which of these is a Class I (transitive) verb?
questions.explanation: ხედვა [khedva] 'to see' is Class I transitive because you see something/someone. მუშაობა [mushaoba] 'to work' is Class II intransitive.

questions.question: დაიწერს [daints'ers] is which person?
questions.explanation: დაიწერს [daints'ers] ends in -ს [-s], which marks third person singular. It has და- preverb and ი- subjective version.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a complete Series I Class I conjugation?
questions.explanation: ვდაუწერ [vdauts'er] contains all components: ვ- subject + და- preverb + უ- version + წერ root. This is a complete Series I Class I transitive conjugation.
